Suggested_Format: Client unique code (e.g., CLIENT-001, or business unit name)
Format_Notes: Alphanumeric, 3-20 chars, no spaces. Examples: BOOT-PROD-A, SOCK-FACILITY-B, APPAREL-LINE-1. Must be UNIQUE across all clients.
Text, 1-100 chars. Examples: 'Western Boot Production Line A', 'Sock Manufacturing Unit 2'
Text, 1-100 chars. Examples: 'John Doe', 'Jane Doe'
Email address format
Phone format
Text. Examples: 'Building A - Line 1', 'Matamoros Facility'

Suggested_Format: Primary supervisor ID for this client
Format_Notes: Foreign key to EMPLOYEE table. Used for escalations and hold approvals.

Suggested_Format: Primary planner or customer service ID for this client
Format_Notes: Foreign key to EMPLOYEE table. Used for escalations and hold approvals.

Suggested_Format: Primary engineer ID for this client
Format_Notes: Foreign key to EMPLOYEE table. Used for escalations and hold approvals.

Suggested_Format: Typically to identify management tracking - Piece Rate / Hourly Rate / Hybrid / Service
Format_Notes: Allowed values: Hourly Rate, Piece Rate, Hybrid, Service, Other

Suggested_Format: Timezone for this client (for report scheduling, timestamps)
Format_Notes: Format: 'America/Mexico_City', 'America/Chicago', etc. (IANA timezone)

Suggested_Format: Is this client currently in operation?
Format_Notes: TRUE or FALSE. Default: TRUE. Set to FALSE to deactivate without deleting.

Suggested_Format: When this client record was created
Format_Notes: ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC). System-generated, not user entry.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC). System-generated.

Suggested_Format: Unique identifier for the work order
Format_Notes: Format: YYYY-MM-DD-MODEL-PARTNUM OR manual ID. Must enforce UNIQUENESS. If duplicate received, append suffix (-01, -02, etc.). Examples: 2025-12-02-BOOT-ABC123, 2025-12-02-BOOT-ABC123-01, WO-20251202-001
Must reference existing client_id. Ensures data isolation per client.
Text, standardized naming per client. Examples: 'ROPER-BOOT', 'CREW-SOCK', 'TEE-SHIRT-V1'. Should match client's naming convention.

Suggested_Format: Total quantity ordered for entire work order
Format_Notes: Positive integer, > 0. Cannot be zero. Example: 1000 (units), Default = 1

Suggested_Format: Planned start date from production schedule
Format_Notes: ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD. If missing, use first job's actual start date. If all missing, system infers from order date + lead time.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD. Captured from first production entry. May differ from planned.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD. REQUIRED for On-Time Delivery (KPI #2). If missing, can infer from planned_start_date + ideal_cycle_time.

Suggested_Format: Alternative to planned_ship_date; required date from customer PO
Format_Notes: ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD. Used if planned_ship_date unavailable. Fallback for OTD calculation.

Suggested_Format: Standard time allowed per unit (in hours)
Format_Notes: Decimal hours. Examples: 0.25 hrs (15 min), 2.5 hrs (2h 30m), 0.083 hrs (5 min). REQUIRED for Efficiency & Performance (KPI #3, #9). If missing, inferred from historical 30-day average by style_model. Engineering maintains master reference.
Allowed values: ACTIVE, ON_HOLD, COMPLETED, REJECTED, CANCELLED. Used for WIP Aging filtering. On-hold status pauses aging clock.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD. Useful for tracking lead time and order-to-start duration.

Suggested_Format: Date Production Planner acknowledged order and created schedule
Format_Notes: ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD. Useful for planning cycle time analysis.
Allowed values: RUSH, STANDARD, LOW. Useful for sorting and escalation. Defaults to STANDARD.
Text, alphanumeric. Example: 'PO-2025-12345'. Used for traceability and customer communication.

Suggested_Format: General notes about this work order
Format_Notes: Free text, up to 1000 chars. Examples: 'Special packaging required', 'Rush order - expedite', 'Quality hold - engineering review pending'.

Suggested_Format: User ID who created this work order
Format_Notes: Foreign key to USER table. Audit trail.

Suggested_Format: When work order was created in system
Format_Notes: ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC). System-generated.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC). System-generated.

Suggested_Format: Unique identifier for this job (line item within work order)
Format_Notes: Format: work_order_id + line number. Examples: '2025-12-02-BOOT-ABC123-L1', '2025-12-02-BOOT-ABC123-L2'. If single job per WO, same as work_order_id.
Links job to its parent work order. One WO can have multiple jobs.

Suggested_Format: Job number (if provided by customer/production planner)
Format_Notes: Text. May be blank if customer doesn't provide. Example: 'J-001', 'JOB-12345'. Used for traceability when provided by Production Planning.
Text, alphanumeric. Examples: 'BOOT-ABC123', 'SOCK-XYZ789'. Must match PART_OPPORTUNITIES table if quality tracking required.

Suggested_Format: Quantity for this specific job/line item
Format_Notes: Positive integer, > 0. Sum of all jobs in WO should equal work_order.planned_quantity.

Suggested_Format: Quantity successfully completed (no rework, no scrap)
Format_Notes: Positive integer, updated as production progresses. Used for progress tracking and FPY/RTY calculations.
Non-negative integer. Tracked separately from defects during operation. Used for quality analysis.
Allowed values: RUSH, STANDARD, LOW. Useful for sorting and escalation. Defaults to STANDARD.
Free text up to 500 chars. Examples: 'Special material required', 'Custom embroidery', 'Fits size XL-2XL'.
Text, alphanumeric. Examples: 'EMP-001', 'OP-12345', '123456'. Must be UNIQUE. Used for attendance, production tracking, coverage assignments.
Text, 1-100 chars. Examples: 'John Doe', 'Mar√≠a Garc√≠a'. Displayed on reports and coverage assignments.
Text. Used for filtering employees by work area. Examples: 'CUTTING', 'SEWING', 'QC', 'ASSEMBLY'.

Suggested_Format: Is this employee part of the floating pool? (shared resource)
Format_Notes: TRUE or FALSE. Default: FALSE. Floating pool employees can be assigned to multiple clients/work centers.

Suggested_Format: Is this employee part of support (non operational hours, i.e. administrative staff not in operations)
Format_Notes: TRUE or FALSE. Default: FALSE. Support employees directly assigned to clients/work centers.

Suggested_Format: Is this employee part of the Support pool? (shared resource included as a service, i.e. engineering, trade compliance, purchasing, other)
Format_Notes: TRUE or FALSE. Default: FALSE. Support pool employees can be assigned to multiple clients/work centers.

Suggested_Format: Primary client/work center assignment (if not floating pool)
Format_Notes: Foreign key to CLIENT table. Only used if is_floating_pool = FALSE. Identifies primary work location.
Hourly wage/rate for this employee (optional, for billing/cost tracking)
Quality_Level_[YOU_FILL_IN]: Decimal currency. Examples: 15.50, 22.75. Not required for KPI calculations, useful for cost analysis.

Format_Notes: TRUE or FALSE. Set to FALSE when employee leaves, no data deletion.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC). System-generated.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC). System-generated.

Suggested_Format: Unique identifier for floating pool resource assignment
Format_Notes: Format: employee_id + timestamp. Examples: 'EMP-001-20251202-143000'. Tracks availability changes over time.

Suggested_Format: Foreign key to EMPLOYEE table (must have is_floating_pool = TRUE)
Format_Notes: Links pool resource to employee record.

Suggested_Format: Current availability status of this floating pool resource
Format_Notes: Allowed values: AVAILABLE, ASSIGNED_CLIENT_A, ASSIGNED_CLIENT_B, ASSIGNED_CLIENT_C, etc. Tracks where floating employee is currently working.

Suggested_Format: Client ID where this floating employee is currently assigned (if not available)
Format_Notes: Foreign key to CLIENT table. NULL if status = AVAILABLE. Updated daily/hourly by supervisors.

Suggested_Format: User ID (supervisor) who made the assignment
Format_Notes: Foreign key to USER table. Audit trail for assignment decisions.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC). System-generated. Used to detect stale assignments (if not updated in 24h, flag as potential error).

Suggested_Format: Notes about this assignment (why assigned, expected duration, etc.)
Format_Notes: Free text up to 500 chars. Example: 'Covering for vacation until 2025-12-15', 'Requested by Client B due to surge'.
Text, alphanumeric. Examples: 'USR-001', 'DATA-COLLECTOR-1'. Used for authentication and audit trails.
Text, 5-50 chars, no spaces. Examples: 'jsmith', 'maria_garcia'. Must be UNIQUE.
Text, 1-100 chars. Examples: 'John Smith', 'Mar√≠a Garc√≠a'.

Suggested_Format: Email address for notifications and contact
Format_Notes: Text, valid email format. Used for daily report delivery and system notifications.
Allowed values: OPERATOR_DATAENTRY, LEADER_DATACONFIG, POWERUSER, ADMIN. Determines system access and override permissions.

Suggested_Format: Client(s) this user has access to (for data entry operators)
Format_Notes: Foreign key to CLIENT table, or COMMA-SEPARATED list for multi-client access. OPERATOR roles typically restricted to 1 client, LEADER/POWERUSER/ADMIN can have multiple.
TRUE or FALSE. Default: TRUE. Set to FALSE to deactivate without deleting.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC). Used for activity tracking and account status monitoring.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC). System-generated.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC). System-generated.
Text, alphanumeric. Must match part_number in JOB table. Examples: 'BOOT-ABC123', 'SOCK-XYZ789'.

Suggested_Format: Number of defect opportunities per unit for DPMO calculation
Format_Notes: Positive integer. Examples: 1 (simple single-point failure), 47 (complex garment with 47 check points). Used for Quality DPMO calculation (KPI #5).

Suggested_Format: Description of part and its opportunities
Format_Notes: Free text. Example: 'Western Boot - opportunities: toe box seam, heel seam, sole adhesion, stitching integrity, fit, color, material defects, etc.'.

Suggested_Format: User ID who last updated opportunities count
Format_Notes: Foreign key to USER table. Usually Quality or Engineering. Audit trail for spec changes.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC). Engineering/Quality updates as specs change.
